org.vaadin.appfoundation.view
Class ViewHandler

java.lang.Object
  org.vaadin.appfoundation.view.ViewHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.vaadin.service.ApplicationContext.TransactionListener, com.vaadin.ui.UriFragmentUtility.FragmentChangedListener, java.io.Serializable
public class ViewHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.vaadin.service.ApplicationContext.TransactionListener, com.vaadin.ui.UriFragmentUtility.FragmentChangedListener

Utility class for handling and chaning views in an application.

Author:
Kim

addView

public static ViewItem addView(java.lang.Object viewId)
Add a new View to the ViewHandler. Takes as input a viewId. The user is responsible of setting the view class. If the viewId is already in use, then null is returned.

Parameters:
viewId - The view's id
Returns:
The resulting ViewItem object

addView

public static ViewItem addView(java.lang.Object viewId,
                               ViewContainer parent)
Add a new view to the view handler.

Parameters:
viewId - The view's id
parent - Parent view for the given view
Returns:
The resulting ViewItem object

addView

public static java.lang.Object addView()
Add a new view. Returns the viewId. Make sure to set either the view instance or the view class for the ViewItem.

Returns:
The viewId

getViewItem

public static ViewItem getViewItem(java.lang.Object viewId)
Fetch the ViewItem for the given viewId. If the viewId is not found, then null is returned.

Parameters:
viewId -
Returns:
The ViewItem object for the given viewId

removeView

public static boolean removeView(java.lang.Object viewId)
Removes the ViewItem from the handler for the given viewId.

Parameters:
viewId -
Returns:
Returns true if the viewId existed, otherwise false.

activateView

public static void activateView(java.lang.Object viewId,
                                java.lang.Object... params)
Activate the view with the given viewId. You can specify any given amount of parameters for the activation request. Each parameter is forwarded to the View's activated() method.

Parameters:
viewId - The view's viewId
params - Parameters used for activating the view

activateView

public static void activateView(java.lang.Object viewId,
                                boolean changeUriFramgent,
                                java.lang.Object... params)
Activate the view with the given viewId. You can specify any given amount of parameters for the activation request. Each parameter is forwarded to the View's activated() method.

Parameters:
viewId - The view's viewId
changeUriFramgent - Should the uri fragment be changed if the view has one set
params - Parameters used for activating the view

deactivateView

public static void deactivateView(java.lang.Object viewId,
                                  java.lang.Object... params)
Deactivate the view with the given viewId. You can specify any given amount of parameters for the deactivation request. Each parameter is forwarded to the View's deactivated() method.

Parameters:
viewId - The view's viewId
params - Parameters used for activating the view

setParent

public static void setParent(java.lang.Object viewId,
                             ViewContainer parent)
Set the parent view for the given viewId.

Parameters:
viewId - The viewId of the ViewItem
parent - New parent for the view

setDefaultViewFactory

public static void setDefaultViewFactory(ViewFactory defaultViewFactory)
Set the default ViewFactory which is to be used in all newly added views.

Parameters:
defaultViewFactory - Default ViewFactory to be used in all new views.
